security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation template containing no executable code, network calls, filesystem access, or external command execution. The skill consists solely of markdown documentation that provides workflow guidance to the AI agent.

content.value_statement: This template provides a standardized structure for creating new Claude Code skills. It ensures consistent documentation, clear activation triggers, and reusable workflow patterns across your skill library.
actual_capabilities: Documents activation triggers and use cases
Includes quality checklist with red flags
limitations: This is a documentation template, not an executable skill
Requires customization for specific use cases
Does not provide actual functionality without modification
Placeholder text must be replaced with real content

use_cases.title: Create New Skills
use_cases.description: Use this template to create consistent, well-documented skills for your Claude Code setup.

use_cases.title: Standardize Documentation
use_cases.description: Ensure all team skills follow the same structure and include required sections.

use_cases.title: Build Plugin Skills
use_cases.description: Use as foundation for skills distributed through the plugin marketplace.

prompt_templates.title: Create New Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the example-skill template to create a new skill for [specific task]. Fill in the overview, when to use section, and protocol steps.

prompt_templates.title: Document Workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Following the example-skill template, document the [specific workflow] including trigger situations, step-by-step protocol, and examples.

prompt_templates.title: Review Existing Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare an existing skill against the example-skill template. Identify missing sections and suggest improvements for consistency.

prompt_templates.title: Create Skill Collection
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the example-skill template to create [number] related skills for [domain]. Ensure they reference each other in the Related section.

output_examples.input: Create a skill for reviewing pull requests using the example-skill template
output: Sections added: Overview, When to use, Protocol (4 steps), Good/Bad examples, Red flags checklist
Ready for customization with actual PR review procedures

best_practices: Always replace placeholder text with specific, actionable content before using the skill
Include concrete examples that match your actual use cases and workflows
Update the activation triggers to match exactly when the skill should be invoked
anti_patterns: Using the template without customizing the protocol steps for your specific workflow
Skipping the red flags section which helps catch quality issues early
Leaving placeholder brackets like [specific trigger situations] instead of replacing them

faq.question: What tools support this skill format?
faq.answer: This skill format is designed for Claude Code and Codex. It uses the standard SKILL.md format with YAML frontmatter.

faq.question: What are the file size limits for skills?
faq.answer: SKILL.md files should remain under 500 lines. Complex workflows should be split into multiple focused skills.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with other skills?
faq.answer: Add references in the Related section. Skills can activate other skills through natural language requests to the AI.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This is a documentation-only template. It reads no files, makes no network calls, and stores no data externally.

faq.question: The skill does not work as expected. What should I check?
faq.answer: Verify you replaced all placeholder text. Ensure activation triggers match your actual request patterns. Test with concrete examples.

faq.question: How does this compare to other skill templates?
faq.answer: This template follows Claude Code's official format with additional sections for protocol steps, examples, and quality checklists.
